pipetteName.description: Name of a pipette. Does not contain info about specific model/version. Should match keys in pipetteNameSpecs.json file

moduleId.description: Unique identifier of module to target. Must be a key from the top level 'modules' object

offset.description: x, y, and z component of offset vector in mm

origin.description: reference location with respect to a well from which to apply an offset if given (e.g. 'bottom' || 'top')

offset.description: X, Y, Z offset from the specified origin with respect to well

$otSharedSchema.description: The path to a valid Opentrons shared schema relative to the shared-data directory, without its extension.

schemaVersion.description: Schema version of a protocol is a single integer

protocolName.description: A short, human-readable name for the protocol

author.description: The author or organization who created the protocol

description.description: A text description of the protocol.

created.description: UNIX timestamp when this file was created

lastModified.description: UNIX timestamp when this file was last modified

tags.description: Tags to be used in searching for this protocol

designerApplication.description: Optional data & metadata not required to execute the protocol, used by the application that created this protocol

name.description: Name of the application that created the protocol. Should be namespaced under the organization or individual who owns the organization, eg "opentrons/protocol-designer"

version.description: Version of the application that created the protocol

data.description: Any data used by the application that created this protocol

model.description: Model of the robot this protocol is written for

deckId.description: Identifier of physical deck this protocol is written for. This should match a top-level key in shared-data/deck/definitions/2.json

pipettes.description: The pipettes used in this protocol, keyed by a unique identifier (pipetteId)

labwareDefinitions.description: All labware definitions used by labware in this protocol, keyed by a unique identifier (definitionId)

labware.description: All instances of labware used in this protocol, and references to their definitionslabwareId, keyed by a unique identifier (labwareId)

definitionId.description: reference to this labware's ID in "labwareDefinitions"

displayName.description: An optional human-readable nickname for this labware instance within this protocol. Eg "Buffer Trough"

liquids.description: All instances of liquid used in this protocol, keyed by a unique identifier (liquidId)

displayName.description: An human-readable name for this liquid.

modules.description: All modules used in this protocol keyed by a unique identifier (moduleId)

.+.description: Fields describing a single module on the deck

model.description: model of module. Eg 'magneticModuleV1' or 'magneticModuleV2'. This should match a top-level key in shared-data/module/definitions/2.json

commands.description: An array of command objects representing steps to be executed on the robot

anyOf.description: Aspirate Liquid / Dispense Liquid / Aspirate Air Gap / Dispense Air Aap
Blowout
Touch Tip
Pick Up Tip / Drop Tip
Move To Slot. NOTE: this is an EXPERIMENTAL command, its behavior is subject to change in future releases.

slotName.description: Unique string identifier that corresponds to a slot in the referenced deck definition's locations

offset.description: Optional offset from slot bottom left corner, in mm

minimumZHeight.description: Optional minimal Z margin in mm. If this is larger than the API's default safe Z margin, it will make the arc higher. If it's smaller, it will have no effect. Specifying this for movements that would not arc (moving within the same well in the same labware) will cause an arc movement instead.

forceDirect.description: Default is false. If true, moving from one labware/well to another will not arc to the default safe z, but instead will move directly to the specified location. This will also force the 'minimumZHeight' param to be ignored. A 'direct' movement is in X/Y/Z simultaneously

anyOf.description: Move To Coordinates

coordinates.description: X, Y and Z coordinates in mm from deck's origin location (left-front-bottom corner of work space)

minimumZHeight.description: Optional minimal Z margin in mm. If this is larger than the API's default safe Z margin, it will make the arc higher. If it's smaller, it will have no effect. Specifying this for movements that would not arc (moving within the same well in the same labware) will cause an arc movement instead.

forceDirect.description: Default is false. If true, moving from one labware/well to another will not arc to the default safe z, but instead will move directly to the specified location. This will also force the 'minimumZHeight' param to be ignored. A 'direct' movement is in X/Y/Z simultaneously

anyOf.description: Move Relative

distance.description: Distance in mm to move the gantry (negative numbers are allowed)

anyOf.description: Save Position

positionId.description: Optional position ID, auto-assigned if left blank

anyOf.description: Home
Delay Protocol Execution

wait.description: either a number of seconds to wait (fractional values OK), or `true` to wait indefinitely until the user manually resumes the protocol

anyOf.description: Magnetic Module Engage: Engage magnet to specified height.

engageHeight.description: Height in mm(*) from bottom plane of labware (above if positive, below if negative). *NOTE: for magneticModuleV1 (aka GEN1), these are not true mm but an arbitrary unit equal to 0.5mm. So `engageHeight: 2` means 1mm above the labware plane if the command is for a GEN1 magnetic module, but would mean 2mm above the labware plane for GEN2 module

moduleId.description: Unique identifier of Magnetic Module to target. Must be a key from the top level 'modules' object.

anyOf.description: Magnetic Module Disengage: Retract magnet to disengaged (home) position

Temperature Module Set Target Temperature: Module will begin moving to the target temperature. This command is non-blocking, it does not delay protocol execution while approaching the target temperature.

moduleId.description: Unique identifier of Temperature Module to target. Must be a key from the top level 'modules' object

anyOf.description: Temperature Module Await Temperature: Delay protocol execution until the specified temperature is reached.

moduleId.description: Unique identifier of Temperature Module to target. Must be a key from the top level 'modules' object

anyOf.description: Temperature Module Deactivate: Module will stop actively controlling its temperature and drift to ambient temperature.

Thermocycler Set Target Block Temperature: Well block will begin moving to the target temperature. This command is non-blocking, it does not delay protocol execution while approaching the target temperature.

moduleId.description: Unique identifier of Thermocycler Module to target. Must be a key from the top level 'modules' object

anyOf.description: Thermocycler Set Target Lid Temperature: Lid will begin moving to the target temperature. This command is non-blocking, it does not delay protocol execution while approaching the target temperature.

moduleId.description: Unique identifier of Thermocycler Module to target. Must be a key from the top level 'modules' object

anyOf.description: Thermocycler Await Block Temperature: Delay protocol execution until the specified well block target temperature is reached.

moduleId.description: Unique identifier of Thermocycler Module to target. Must be a key from the top level 'modules' object

anyOf.description: Thermocycler Await Lid Temperature: Delay protocol execution until the specified lid target temperature is reached.

moduleId.description: Unique identifier of Thermocycler Module to target. Must be a key from the top level 'modules' object

anyOf.description: Thermocycler Deactivate Block: Module will stop actively controlling its well block temperature.
Thermocycler Deactivate Lid: Module will stop actively controlling its lid temperature.
Thermocycler Open Lid: Open lid of the module. This command will delay protocol execution until the lid is fully open.
Thermocycler Close Lid: Close the lid of the module. This command will delay protocol execution until the lid is fully closed.

Thermocycler Run Profile: Begin running the specified profile steps on the Thermocycler. This command is non-blocking, it does not delay protocol execution outside of thermocycler steps. No more thermocycler commands should be given until a 'thermocycler/awaitProfileComplete' command is executed.

moduleId.description: Unique identifier of Thermocycler Module to target. Must be a key from the top level 'modules' object

holdTime.description: Time (in seconds) to hold once temperature is reached

anyOf.description: Thermocycler Await Profile Complete: Delay protocol execution until profile execution is complete.

Heater Shaker Module Set Target Temperature: Module will begin moving to the target temperature. This command is non-blocking, it does not delay protocol execution while approaching the target temperature.

moduleId.description: Unique identifier of Heater Shaker Module to target. Must be a key from the top level 'modules' object

temperature.description: target temperature to heat to in °C

anyOf.description: Heater Shaker Module Set Target Shake Speed: Module will begin accelerating to the target shake speed. This command is non-blocking, it does not delay protocol execution while approaching the target shake speed.

moduleId.description: Unique identifier of Heater Shaker Module to target. Must be a key from the top level 'modules' object

anyOf.description: Heater Shaker Module Await Temperature: Delay protocol execution until the specified target temperature is reached.

moduleId.description: Unique identifier of Heater Shaker Module to target. Must be a key from the top level 'modules' object

anyOf.description: Heater Shaker Module Await Speed: Delay protocol execution until the specified target shake speed is reached.

moduleId.description: Unique identifier of Heater Shaker Module to target. Must be a key from the top level 'modules' object

rpm.description: target rotations per minute to await

anyOf.description: Heater Shaker Module Deactivate Heater: Module will stop actively heating and drift to ambient temperature.

Move To Well: Move the pipette's critical point to the specified well in a labware, with an optional offset. The pipette's critical point is a reference point on the pipette. The critical point can be one of the following: (1) Single-channel pipette with no tip: end of nozzle. (2) Multi-channel pipette with no tip: end of backmost nozzle. (3) Single-channel pipette with a tip: end of tip. (4) Multi-channel pipette with tip: end of tip on backmost nozzle.

minimumZHeight.description: Optional minimal Z margin in mm. If this is larger than the API's default safe Z margin, it will make the arc higher. If it's smaller, it will have no effect. Specifying this for movements that would not arc (moving within the same well in the same labware) will cause an arc movement instead.

forceDirect.description: Default is false. If true, moving from one labware/well to another will not arc to the default safe z, but instead will move directly to the specified location. This will also force the 'minimumZHeight' param to be ignored. A 'direct' movement is in X/Y/Z simultaneously

anyOf.description: Load Pipette: This command is only meant to make the Opentrons system aware of a pipette's location. It does not instruct any specific hardware to carry out the physical action of moving the pipette to the location.

pipetteId.description: Unique identifier of pipette to load

mount.description: Unique identifier of physical destination location to load pipette into (e.g. 'left')

anyOf.description: Load Labware: This command is only meant to make the Opentrons system aware of a labware instance's location. It does not instruct any specific hardware to carry out the physical action of moving the labware instance to the location.

labwareId.description: Unique identifier of labware to load

location.description: Physical destination location to load labware into (e.g. '1' || 'someModuleId')

slotName.description: Unique string identifier that corresponds to a slot in the referenced deck definition's locations

moduleId.description: Unique identifier of destination module. Must be a key from the top level 'modules' object.

labwareId.description: Unique identifier of destination labware. Must be a key from the top level 'labware' object.

anyOf.description: Load Module: This command is only meant to make the Opentrons system aware of a module instance's location. It does not instruct any specific hardware to carry out the physical action of moving the module instance to the location.

moduleId.description: Unique identifier of module to load

location.description: Physical destination location to load module into (e.g. '1')

slotName.description: Unique string identifier that corresponds to a slot in the referenced deck definition's locations

anyOf.description: Load Liquid: This command is only meant to make the Opentrons system aware of a liquid's location. It does not instruct any specific hardware to carry out the physical action of moving the liquid to the location.

liquidId.description: Unique identifier of instance of liquid to load. Must be a key from the top level 'liquids' object

labwareId.description: Unique identifier of labware to load liquid into. Must be a key from the top level 'labware' object

.+.description: Volume in µL keyed by wellName from the specified labware

anyOf.description: Custom: This command is meant to allow non-canonical commands to be included in the commands list.

params.description: all of the parameters required to identify and execute this command

items.description: An optional object of annotations associated with commands.

commandIds.description: An array of command ids that correspond to the targeted grouping of this annotation

params.description: The parameters used to create this grouping of atomic commands
